text: Paul an Apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: To Timothy my beloved son: Grace, mercy and peace from God the Father, and from Jesus Christ our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank God, whom I serve from mine elders with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Desiring to see thee, mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy:
speaker: Narrator

text: When I call to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee, which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and in thy mother Eunice, and am assured that it dwelleth in thee also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore, I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God which is in thee, by the putting on of mine hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God hath not given to us the Spirit of fear, but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, neither of me his prisoner: but be partaker of the afflictions of the Gospel according to the power of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who hath saved us, and called us with an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given to us through Christ Jesus before the world was,
speaker: Narrator

text: But is now made manifest by that appearing of our Savior Jesus Christ, who hath abolished death, and hath brought life and immortality unto light through the Gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whereunto I am appointed a preacher, and Apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the which cause I also suffer these things, but I am not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and I am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed to him against that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep the true pattern of the wholesome words, which thou hast heard of me in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: That worthy thing, which was committed to thee, keep through the holy Ghost, which dwelleth in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: This thou knowest, that all they which are in Asia, be turned from me: of which sort are Phygellus and Hermogenes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus: for he oft refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain,
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he was at Rome, he sought me out very diligently, and found me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord grant unto him, that he may find mercy with the Lord at that day, and in how many things he hath ministered unto me at Ephesus, thou knowest very well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what things thou hast heard of me, by many witnesses, the same deliver to faithful men, which shall be able to teach others also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou therefore suffer affliction as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man that warreth, entangleth himself with the affairs of this life, because he would please him that hath chosen him to be a soldier.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if any man also strive for a mastery, he is not crowned, except he strive as he ought to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: The husbandman must labor before he receive the fruits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider what I say: and the Lord give thee understanding in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember that Jesus Christ, made of the seed of David, was raised again from the dead according to my Gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherein I suffer trouble as an evil doer, even unto bonds: but the word of God is not bound.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I suffer all things for the electâ€™s sake, that they might also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus, with eternal glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a true saying, For if we be dead together with him: we also shall live together with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we suffer, we shall also reign together with him: if we deny him, he also will deny us.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we believe not, yet abideth he faithful: he cannot deny himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of these things put them in remembrance, and protest before the Lord, that they strive not about words, which is to no profit, but to the perverting of the hearers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Study to show thyself approved unto God a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, dividing the word of truth aright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stay profane, and vain babblings: for they shall increase unto more ungodliness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their word shall fret as a canker: of which sort is Hymenaeus and Philetus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which as concerning the truth have erred from the mark, saying that the resurrection is past already, and do destroy the faith of certain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the foundation of God remaineth sure, and hath this seal, The Lord knoweth who are his: and, Let everyone that calleth on the Name of Christ, depart from iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding in a great house are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth, and some for honor, and some unto dishonor.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honor, sanctified, and meet for the Lord, and prepared unto every good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Flee also from the lusts of youth, and follow after righteousness, faith, love, and peace, with them that call on the Lord with pure heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: And put away foolish and unlearned questions, knowing that they engender strife.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the servant of the Lord must not strive, but must be gentle toward all men, apt to teach, suffering the evil,
speaker: Narrator

text: Instructing them with meekness that are contrary minded, proving if God at any time will give them repentance, that they may acknowledge the truth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And come to amendment out of that snare of the devil, of whom they are taken prisoners, to do his will.
speaker: Narrator

text: This know also, that in the last days shall come perilous times.
speaker: Narrator

text: For men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, cursed speakers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,
speaker: Narrator

text: Without natural affection, truce breakers, false accusers, intemperate, fierce, no lovers at all of them which are good,
speaker: Narrator

text: Traitors, heady, high-minded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: Having a show of godliness, but have denied the power thereof: turn away therefore from such.
speaker: Narrator

text: For of this sort are they which creep into houses, and lead captive simple women laden with sins, and led with divers lusts,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which women are ever learning, and are never able to come to the acknowledging of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth, men of corrupt minds, reprobate concerning the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they shall prevail no longer: for their madness shall be evident unto all men, as theirs also was.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of living, purpose, faith, longsuffering, love, patience,
speaker: Narrator

text: Persecutions, and afflictions which came unto me at Antioch, at Iconium, and at Lystra, which persecutions I suffered: but from them all the Lord delivered me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus, shall suffer persecution.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the evil men and deceivers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived.
speaker: Narrator

text: But continue thou in the things which thou hast learned, and which are committed unto thee, knowing of whom thou hast learned them:
speaker: Narrator

text: And that thou hast known the holy Scriptures of a child, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation, through the faith which is in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the whole Scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable to teach, to convince, to correct, and to instruct in righteousness,
speaker: Narrator

text: That the man of God may be absolute, being made perfect unto all good works.
speaker: Narrator

text: I Charge thee therefore before God, and before the Lord Jesus Christ, which shall judge the quick and dead at that his appearing, and in his kingdom,
speaker: Narrator

text: Preach the word: be instant, in season, and out of season: improve, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the time will come when they will not suffer wholesome doctrine: but having their ears itching, shall after their own lusts get them an heap of teachers,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shall turn their ears from the truth, and shall be given unto fables.
speaker: Narrator

text: But watch thou in all things: suffer adversity: do the work of an Evangelist: cause thy ministry to be thoroughly liked of.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departing is at hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have fought a good fight, and have finished my course: I have kept the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: For henceforth is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord the righteous Judge shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love that his appearing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make speed to come unto me at once:
speaker: Narrator

text: For Demas hath forsaken me, and hath embraced this present world, and is departed unto Thessalonica. Crescens is gone to Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark and bring him with thee: for he is profitable unto me to minister.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bring with thee, and the books, but specially the parchments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Alexander the coppersmith hath done me much evil: the Lord reward him according to his works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of whom be thou ware also: for he withstood our preaching sore.
speaker: Narrator

text: At my first answering no man assisted me, but all forsook me: I pray God, that it may not be laid to their charge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding the Lord assisted me, and strengthened me, that by me the preaching might be fully believed, and that all the Gentiles should hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me unto his heavenly kingdom: to whom be praise for ever and ever, Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Erastus abode at Corinth: Trophimus I left at Miletus sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make speed to come before winter. Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy Spirit. Grace be with you, Amen.
The second Epistle written from Rome unto Timothy, the first Bishop elected of the Church of Ephesus, when Paul was presented the second time before the Emperor Nero.
speaker: Narrator
